summary.para: A class have s, s, and the chain information.

In order to watch its state changes, implement interface and pass it to the
constructor.

member.remarks: This object is guaranteed that it has at least one block, since it takes a genesis block when it's instantiated.

The genesis of the , which is a part of the consensus. If the given already contains the genesis block it checks if the existing genesis block and this argument is the same. If the has no genesis block yet this argument will be used for that.
The implementation for state lookup.
The implementation to calculate next states when append new blocks.
Listens state changes on the created chain. Listens nothing by default or if it is . Note that action renderers receive events made by unsuccessful transactions as well.

member.name: M:Libplanet.Blockchain.BlockLocator.Create(System.Int64,System.Func{System.Int64,System.Nullable{Libplanet.Types.Blocks.BlockHash}},System.Int64)

summary.para: Creates a new instance of with an indexer function, sampling after number of s.

This collects all es corresponding to indices inductively defined by:
i_0 = startIndex
i_k = max(i_(k - 1) - 1, 0) for 0 < k and k <= s
i_k = max(i_(k - 1) - 2^(k - 1 - s), 0) for 0 < k and s < k
where s = max(sampleAfter, 0) and the sequence terminates after index i_k reaches zero or the returned by for i_k is , in which case the corresponding to index 0 (presumably a of the genesis ) is added at the end.

member.param: The starting index.
The function that converts an index to a . This can be which indicates a missing at the index. Any value from 0 to may be used as an argument to call this function.
The number of consecutive blocks to include before sampling.
member.exception: Thrown when is negative.
Thrown when either returned by for index 0 is .
member.returns: An instance of created with given arguments.
member.remarks: Returned created by this factory method is guaranteed to have the corresponding to index 0.

member.name: T:Libplanet.Blockchain.Policies.BlockPolicy
member.summary: A default implementation of interface.

summary.para: Each unprovided argument will be assigned a default value. See each parameter description for more detail.

member.param: A to executed for every . Set to by default, which results in no additional execution other than those included in s.
Goes to . Set to by default.
The predicate that determines if a follows the policy. Set to a constant function of by default.
The predicate that determines if a follows the policy. Set to a default implementation where block's hash algorithm type, bytes count, and transactions count are validated.
The function determining the maximum size of in number of bytes given its . Goes to . Set to a constant size of 100KiB, i.e. 100 * 1024, by default.
The function determining the minimum number of s that must be included in a . Goes to . Set to a constant function of 0 by default.
The function determining how many s can be included in a . Goes to . Set to a constant function of 100 by default.
The function determining the maximum number of transactions from the same signer that can be included in a given the 's index. Goes to . Set to by default.

summary.para: An interface to determine if consecutive s are valid.
An implementation of this interface should perform all policy dependent checks, such as whether a has the right difficulty, a has the right signer, etc.
Note that all index dependent sub-policies are ignored for genesis s.

summary.para: An in memory implementation of the .

This implementation holds on to every unconfirmed except for the following reasons:
A has been specifically marked to be ignored due to not being valid.
A has expired due to its staleness.
Additionally, any with a lower nonce than that of returned by the is masked and filtered by default.

member.summary: Creates a new instance. By default, is set to 10 minutes.

member.summary: Creates a new instance.
member.param: Volatilizes staged transactions older than this . See also .

member.name: P:Libplanet.Blockchain.Policies.VolatileStagePolicy.Lifetime
member.summary: Lifespan for s. Any older than this will be considered expired.
member.remarks: Expired s cannot be staged.

member.name: M:Libplanet.Blockchain.Policies.VolatileStagePolicy.GetInner(Libplanet.Blockchain.BlockChain,Libplanet.Types.Tx.TxId,System.Boolean)
member.remarks: It has been intended to avoid recursive lock, hence doesn't hold any synchronous scope. Therefore, we should manage the lock from its caller side.

member.name: T:Libplanet.Blockchain.Renderers.IActionRenderer
member.summary:
Listens state changes of every step of actions, besides blocks, on a . If you need more fine-grained events than , implement this interface instead.
The invocation order of methods for each are:
(one time)
& (zero or more times)
(one time)
member.remarks: Although s affect the states in the all or nothing at all (i.e., atomically), receives all action-related events (/) immediately without buffering, which means actions are rendered even before whether there are any actions throwing an exception in the same transaction is determined. In other words, for s, it is not guaranteed that actions in a transaction are atomic.

member.name: M:Libplanet.Blockchain.Renderers.IActionRenderer.RenderAction(Bencodex.Types.IValue,Libplanet.Action.ICommittedActionContext,Libplanet.Common.HashDigest{System.Security.Cryptography.SHA256})
member.summary: Does things that should be done right after an is executed and applied to the blockchain.
member.param: An executed action.
The equivalent context object to an object passed to the 's method. That means are the states right before this action executed. For the states after this action executed, use the argument instead.
The state root hash right after this action executed, which means it is equivalent to the states 's method returned.
member.remarks:
It is guaranteed to be called only once for an , and only after applied to the blockchain, unless an exception is thrown during executing the (in that case is called instead) or once the has been unrendered.
Also note that this method is invoked after method is called (where its second parameter newTip contains a transaction the belongs to).

member.name: M:Libplanet.Blockchain.Renderers.IActionRenderer.RenderActionError(Bencodex.Types.IValue,Libplanet.Action.ICommittedActionContext,System.Exception)
member.summary: Does the similar things to , except that this method is invoked when has terminated with an exception.
member.param: An action which threw an exception during execution.
The equivalent context object to an object passed to the 's method. That means are the states right before this action executed.
The exception thrown during executing the .
member.remarks: Also note that this method is invoked after method is called (where its second parameter newTip contains a transaction the belongs to).

member.name: M:Libplanet.Blockchain.Renderers.IActionRenderer.RenderBlockEnd(Libplanet.Types.Blocks.Block,Libplanet.Types.Blocks.Block)
member.summary: Does things that should be done right all actions in a new are rendered.
member.remarks: It is guaranteed to be called only once for a block.
member.param: The previous .
The current .

member.name: T:Libplanet.Blockchain.Renderers.IRenderer
member.summary:
Listens state changes on a .
Usually, implementations of this interface purpose to update the in-memory game states (if exist), or send a signal to the UI thread (usually the main thread) so that the graphics on the display is redrawn.
The invocation order of methods for each are:
(one time)

member.name: M:Libplanet.Blockchain.Renderers.IRenderer.RenderBlock(Libplanet.Types.Blocks.Block,Libplanet.Types.Blocks.Block)
member.summary: Does things that should be done right after a new is appended to a (so that its has changed).
member.remarks: It is guaranteed to be called only once for a block, and only after applied to the blockchain, unless it has been stale due to reorg.
member.param: The previous .
The current .

member.name: T:Libplanet.Blockchain.Renderers.LoggedActionRenderer
member.summary:
Decorates an so that all event messages are logged. In other words, this is an version of .
Every single event message causes two log messages: one is logged before rendering, and other one is logged after rendering. If any exception is thrown it is also logged with the log level (regardless of configuration).

member.name: M:Libplanet.Blockchain.Renderers.LoggedActionRenderer.#ctor(Libplanet.Blockchain.Renderers.IActionRenderer,Serilog.ILogger,Serilog.Events.LogEventLevel)
member.summary: Creates a new instance which decorates the given action .
member.param: The actual action renderer to forward all event messages to and actually render things.
The logger to write log messages to. Note that all log messages this decorator writes become in the context of the 's type (with the context property SourceContext).
The log event level. All log messages become this level.

member.name: P:Libplanet.Blockchain.Renderers.LoggedActionRenderer.ActionRenderer
member.summary: The inner action renderer to forward all event messages to and actually render things.

member.name: T:Libplanet.Blockchain.Renderers.LoggedRenderer
member.summary:
Decorates an so that all event messages are logged.
Every single event message causes two log messages: one is logged before rendering, and other one is logged after rendering. If any exception is thrown it is also logged with the log level (regardless of configuration).
member.remarks: Since is a subtype of , constructor can take an instance as well. However, even it takes an action renderer, action-level fine-grained events will not be logged. For action renderers, please use instead.

member.name: M:Libplanet.Blockchain.Renderers.LoggedRenderer.#ctor(Libplanet.Blockchain.Renderers.IRenderer,Serilog.ILogger,Serilog.Events.LogEventLevel)
member.summary: Creates a new instance which decorates the given .
member.param: The actual renderer to forward all event messages to and actually render things.
The logger to write log messages to. Note that all log messages this decorator writes become in the context of the 's type (with the context property SourceContext).
The log event level. All log messages become this level.

member.name: P:Libplanet.Blockchain.Renderers.LoggedRenderer.Renderer
member.summary: The inner renderer to forward all event messages to and actually render things.

member.name: P:Libplanet.Blockchain.Renderers.LoggedRenderer.Level
member.summary: The log event level. All log messages become this level.

member.name: P:Libplanet.Blockchain.Renderers.LoggedRenderer.Logger
member.summary: The logger to write log messages to. Note that all log messages this decorator writes become in the context of the 's type (with the context property SourceContext).

member.name: T:Libplanet.KeyStore.Web3KeyStore
member.summary:
Web3 Secret Storage (i.e., Ethereum-style key store) compliant implementation. Key files are placed in a directory of the .
Use property to get an instance.
In order to get an instance with a customized directory, use the constructor.

member.summary: Creates a instance with a custom directory .
member.param: A path of the directory to store key files. A new directory is created if not exists.
member.exception: Thrown when is passed to .

member.name: P:Libplanet.KeyStore.Web3KeyStore.DefaultKeyStore
member.summary:
A default instance which refers to a user-local directory. The differs on the platform:
OS Directory path
Linux/macOS $HOME/.config/planetarium/keystore
Windows %AppData%\planetarium\keystore
